label: 日記の家
本: From Sovereign to Symbol: An Age of Ritual Determinism in Fourteenth Century Japan . Oxford University Press . 2012
見出し読み: にっき の いえ
説明文: A chronicler house" generally of the Fujiwara lineage, whose adherents possessed privately held compendia of precedent. a handful of noble families which monopolized detaild knowledge of past ritual minutia through privately held compendia. These chronicles were jealously guarded and came to be the prized estate of noble families, particularly those of the Northern Branch of the Fujiwara."
